intro: Senecio caldasensis, commonly known as the Caldasensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky habitats, showcasing adaptations to its harsh environment. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio caldasensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
